result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsay L Chadwick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count #1 the Court sentences Ms. Chadwick to 15 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1  year &  0  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  0 years &  3  months.  This sentence is to consecutive to any sentence in being. 
The Court gives 0  days credit for time already served.
The Court finds Ms. Chadwick is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds Ms. Chadwick is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

**Per 11/19/20 Order: The Court determines that the additional 4 days credit on 15CM487 is appropriate. JOC shall be amended accordingly.**

records.addlTxt: Transcript of 5-26-17 Sentencing After Revocation (Prison)
DOC financial print screen

[MK] cases #14CF447 and #15CM487 called at 11:20am.
Defendant Lindsay L Chadwick in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
Ms. Chadwick makes a statement.

On Case #14CF447-Counts #2, #3, #4, & #5 each the Court sentences Ms. Chadwick to serve 125 days in Jail concurrent with each other and any other sentence in being (time served).
Days credit for time already served:  125 days.
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for any unpaid court financial obligations. 
--------------------------------------

On Case #15CM487-Count #1 the Court sentences Ms. Chadwick to 15 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1  year &  0  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  0 years &  3  months.  This sentence is to consecutive to any sentence in being. 
The Court gives 0  days credit for time already served.
The Court finds Ms. Chadwick is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds Ms. Chadwick is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA assessment & follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety; no presence in bars or taverns
--to pay the balance due on court financial obligations
--to submit to drug testing per Agent

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 11:45am
Transcript of Plea & Sentencing Hearing - 6/21/16
cc: DA (Cert. copy) by COC on 4/24/17. sf
to produce and transport the defendant for proceedings in Br 2, Rm 229 of the Circuit Court of Jefferson County on May 26, 2017 at 11:15 AM  from WALWORTH COUNTY JAIL
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 26, 2017 at 11:15 am.
with criminal case settlement and elements

Case called at 9:24 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Lindsay L Chadwick in court, in-custody, from Walworth County, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ confirms victim rights compliance, no request to be heard. Court finds Ch950 compliance.
Court finds that Miss Chadwick is a repeater

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2, futher prosecution is barred and jeopardy attaches

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions as set forth in the criminal case settlement form, which include:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment, per Agent
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Atttempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety; no presence in bars or taverns
--Fine and/or costs
--Other costs/fees
--Drug testing per agent

Court additionally orders: 
--The Defendant to pay DNA Surcharge
Court determines Miss Chadwick has already submitted DNA Sample and does not order one to be taken

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 9:45 am
and Transport the Defendant from Walworth County Jail on June 21, 2016 for proceedings in Branch 3

Case called at 4:13 pm [sf]
Defendant Lindsay L Chadwick in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies DOB and address with the defendant.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited.
Court reviews the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Defendant advises that she would like an attorney.
Court will adjourn to allow the defendant time to seek counsel.

Court requires a $1,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Daniel Sutton or Timothy Beck
-Booking at JCSD, Court gives the defendant no later than 4pm tomorrow 2/17/16
